Game.Name: Avatar - The Last Airbender - The Burning Earth (USA)
Game.plot: Overview:Avatar: The Last Airbender - The Burning Earth was the second Avatar video game. It is available for a variety of platforms, but most notoriously for the Xbox 360 in which it is possible to earn all 1000 achievement points in less than a minute. The Burning Earth features a multiplayer mode, and multiple playable characters. The game covers the second volume of the Avatar TV show, the Book of Earth.Playable Characters Aang Sokka Toph Katara ZukoIrohJetMomoAppaXbox 360 Game InstallationAvatar: The Last Airbender - The Burning Earth requires 5.1GB of space to install on an Xbox 360 HDD.Xbox 360 Games on DemandOn March 23, 2010, Avatar: The Last Airbender - The Burning Earth became available on the Xbox 360's Games on Demand service. Game.Notes: Avatar: The Last Airbender – The Burning Earth (known as Avatar: The Legend of Aang – The Burning Earth in Europe) is a video game for Wii, Nintendo DS, Game Boy Advance, PlayStation 2, and Xbox 360 based on the animated television series Avatar: The Last Airbender. It was one of the last games released for the Game Boy Advance in North America. The game was followed by a sequel, Avatar: The Last Airbender – Into the Inferno, around a year later. The game is infamous for its incredibly easy Xbox 360 1000G Achievement score, which can quickly be unlocked in under five minutes.
